findings.title: Possible accounting corruption between individualRestriction and defaultRestriction
findings.description: If individualRestriction and defaultRestriction have the same period offset and individualRestriction ends inside defaultRestriction, it's possible for them to touch the same buckets after individualRestriction ends, leading to problems in _bucketCheck() function.

findings.title: Possible accounting corruption between consecutive restrictions
findings.description: Corrupted accounting in _bucketCheck() due to new restriction sharing its first bucket with the last bucket of the previous restriction when a restricted transaction happens with fromTimestamp == now, followed by removal and addition of new restrictions.

findings.title: Use external functions
findings.description: It's recommended to mark interfacing functions as external for clarity and consistency.

findings.title: Reasons for revert are not descriptive
findings.description: Most of the error messages in the contract are simply 'not allowed', which does not provide much information about the error itself.

findings.title: Avoid repetitive code
findings.description: Some functions can be abstracted to avoid code repetition.

findings.title: ITransferManager contains implementation
findings.description: Contracts prefixed with 'I' are expected to be interfaces without implementation, but ITransferManager contains implementation.

findings.title: Prefix parameters with _ if function is internal
findings.description: Internal functions do not comply with code style of prefixing parameter names with '_'.

findings.title: VolumeRestrictionTM: restrictionType is passed as uint256 in several occasions
findings.description: The type definition enum RestrictionType { Fixed, Percentage } could be used instead for clarity.

findings.title: VolumeRestrictionTM: Incorrect commenting of addIndividualDailyRestriction
findings.description: The function addIndividualDailyRestriction has incorrect comments, stating it adds new individual daily restrictions for all token holders, but actually applies restrictions to individual holders.
